newsitem.title: FRANCE: AGF sells nine pct of Scor stake.
newsitem.headline: AGF sells nine pct of Scor stake.

text.p: French insurer Assurances Generales de France (AGF) said on Friday it had sold nine percent of its 9.71 percent stake in the country's leading reinsurer Scor, making a 47 million franc net capital gain.
"Today, we have only 0.70 pecent of Scor, and we will keep that," an AGF spokeswoman said. AGF had indicated earlier it would be interested in disposing of its stake.
The AGF spokeswoman made the statement following news that fellow French insurer Axa had sold its full 9.7 percent stake, making a net capital gain of 22.5 million francs.
The AGF shares were sold at an average price of 204.50 francs, net of brokerage fees, and the sales had been staggered over the period since its privatisation in May, AGF said.

The value of shares in Scor, which announced in June it would list its shares on the New York Stock Exchange by year end, have climbed by more than 33 percent since the start of the year, making conditions good for disposal.
Scor shares were up 4.9 francs at 208.90 at 1041 GMT. AGF shares were slightly weaker, down 0.90 francs at 130.70.

Scor's largest shareholder, Union des Assurances de Paris (UAP), has said it might cut its 40.9 percent stake in Scor when it lists in New York, a move expected some time this fall, likely in September.
